intro: Heracleum sibiricum f. angustissimum, commonly known as narrowleaf cowparn, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are narrow and linear, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, characteristic of the carrot family. The plant is native to regions of Europe and Asia, including parts of Russia and Central Asia.
